intro: Geitonoplesium cymosum f. album, commonly known as the white star gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforest areas. The foliage is generally dark green and glossy, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
